title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: The Prime Minister’s office has inadvertently sent out the Coalition’s confidential talking points to the media on Monday. The points covered sensitive issues including Medevac laws and the defence of Gladys Liu over her alleged links to the Chinese communist party. Meanwhile, the Coalition has ordered a fresh investigation in to the big four banks for failing to pass on repeated interest rate cuts in full. Treasurer Josh Frydenberg directed the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) to investigate the interest rate pricing of residential mortgages. The government said it would consider further action against the banks, but Labor’s Stephen Jones told Sky News the inquiry was “too little too late”. Image: News Corp Australia
